title: “variable”
b
must be able to be expressed as a number, and can represent a remarkable variety of things:

inline_content.Text: must be able to be expressed as a number, and can represent a remarkable variety of things:

title: the red component of an R,G,B color.

inline_content.Text: the red component of an R,G,B color.

title: anything that can be expressed as a number.

inline_content.Text: anything that can be expressed as a number.

title: “duration”
b
must be able to be expressed as a number and can also be a variety of things:

inline_content.Text: must be able to be expressed as a number and can also be a variety of things:

title: a quantity of animation loops to be executed,

inline_content.Text: a quantity of animation loops to be executed,

title: anything that can be expressed as

inline_content.Text: anything that can be expressed as

title: “unevenly”
b
means that the variable progresses from beginning to ending values unevenly:

inline_content.Text: means that the variable progresses from beginning to ending values unevenly:

title: faster at the beginning & slower at the ending – or visa-versa,

inline_content.Text: faster at the beginning & slower at the ending – or visa-versa,

title: overshoots the ending but backs up to the ending as the duration finishes,

inline_content.Text: overshoots the ending but backs up to the ending as the duration finishes,

title: repeatedly advances/retreats elastically during the duration,

inline_content.Text: repeatedly advances/retreats elastically during the duration,

title: “bounces” off the ending while coming to rest as the duration finishes.

inline_content.Text: “bounces” off the ending while coming to rest as the duration finishes.

title: Attribution: Robert Penner has created the “gold standard” of easing functions.

inline_content.Text: Attribution: Robert Penner has created the “gold standard” of easing functions.
